criteria: Accuracy in Identifying States and Territories:
Accuracy in Describing Locations and Geographical Features:
Understanding of Geographical Features (Mountain Ranges, Rivers, Plant Regions):
descriptions: Fails to identify any states or territories that existed in 1850.
Identifies only a few states or territories with significant inaccuracies in location.
Identifies some states and territories, but with several inaccuracies in location or names.
Identifies most of the states and territories with minor inaccuracies.
Accurately identifies nearly all states and territories that existed in 1850.
Accurately and comprehensively identifies all states and territories that existed in 1850.
Unable to describe the location or geographical features of any state or territory.
Provides minimal descriptions with major inaccuracies regarding location and geographical features.
Describes location and geographical features for a few states/territories but with inaccuracies.
Describes location and geographical features for most states/territories with some inaccuracies.
Accurately describes locations and major geographical features for nearly all states/territories.
Accurately and comprehensively describes locations and major geographical features for all states/territories, including relevant details.
Demonstrates no understanding of major geographical features relevant to the states and territories.
Shows a very limited understanding, with significant inaccuracies.
Identifies some geographical features but struggles to connect them to specific states/territories.
Connects most geographical features to the correct states/territories with some minor errors.
Demonstrates a strong understanding of geographical features and accurately connects them to specific states/territories.
Demonstrates comprehensive understanding, accurately connecting geographical features to states/territories, and explains their significance.
